Description: Fragment of shoulder of North Ionian pottery amphora(?); a grazing deer faces left, surrounded by rosettes and filling motifs in black on a white slip. The head of the deer is in outline with added detail in black while the body is black with added dapples in red and white. There is a slight protrusion at the top of the sherd indicating the turn to the neck. Interior reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also published in Hürmüzlü 2004, 84 Abb. 15. Clay analysis shows that the piece belongs to group B, North Ionia.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220, no. 71)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 110, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.8)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 83-4, Nau 21, pl. 5b-c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.031)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5752 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
